text: Horrible experience with paypal .
Bought 6 guitars on ebay , purchased paypal's moneyback guarantee .
Guitars were of poor quality so I tried to send back .
Paypal instructs you to send to their P.O . box , which UPS and FedEx will not send to .
The package was too big to send with US mail .
Paypal informed me that the item was too big to qualify for their money back guarantee program even though they had offered it .
When I asked how was I to know without seeing the item if it was too big or not , they had no answer .
Their customer service is the worst I have ever encountered .
When I asked to speak to a supervisor they said they would have a manager contact me .

Target: they would have a manager contact me

text: This consisted of a form email asking me to do the same paperwork I had already done .
I will never use their service again .
Buyer beware !
I have not had a problem with Paypal's service and have not had any problems with my payments .
Also , Paypal will investigate problems of undelivered auctions .
Twice I had to have Paypal investigate a seller I paid through them .
Both times it was for undelivered merchandise .
I reported the problem to Paypal and they did all the investigating and insured the seller refunded my money .
If you are buying at auctions sites I recommend Paypal because it is more secure and can investigate problem sellers .

Also , another bonus is paying by credit card through Paypal , because you also have the added protection offered through your credit card to investigate undelivered or damaged goods if Paypal could not rectify the problem .
It's a shame that a digital transaction can take a week or more...I could send a check in that time .
It takes up to 3 days to perform an *electronic* transfer of money into your PayPal account ( explain that ! ) , then that much time again to pay somebody .
PayPal claims that a deposit is dependent on the time frame of your bank .
And I understand that banks will delay transactions to eke out as much interest out of your deposits as possible .

Considering that PayPal is owned by the company that ran the online bank X.com , and operates PayPal as an interest-bearing cash account for you ( and themselves ) , I wouldn't be surprised if they were party to the delays too .
I don't know whose fault it is or what causes it , but PayPal is a little overrated when it comes to conveniently paying people .
I have used it more then 7 to 8 times a month .
It is a great way to pay when I purchase something on ebay and better yet , when someone buys from me .
If you want to buy from me , paypal is the best way to do it if you want your product NOW .
Send me a check : 3-5 days to reach me , 2-5 days to clear , 1-10 days shipping it to you .
I don't think that I have ever had more then a 1 day delay on funds tranferring from one person to the next .
Fast , easy , and cheap .
## PoorOldEdgarDerby %% 03/08/2001 %% 5
I've had a PayPal account for about a year now and I've been extremely satisfied with it .
It is unbelievably convenient for things like auctions , for which I have used it many times as both the seller and the buyer .
It's also great for times when someone wants to send you money .

For instance I bought some shoes for my father that he wanted but that I could get for a considerable discount because of an employee friend of mine , so I bought them and dropped them in the mail and he PayPaled me the money .
From there it's just a click of the mouse to wire transfer it into my bank account and it's free .
I have only two problems with PayPal :
1 . ) currently you can't use if for things like your average everyday purchase such as if I go to Amazon or some other etailer .
I still need to use a credit card .

I would much prefer to have an online account and just pay for it through that account which contains a finite amount of money and I can check whenver I want , updates immediately , etc . rather than have to keep a watchful eye on my credit card to be sure I'm not getting overcharged ( which has happened )

2 . ) I was somewhat miffed to have to upgrade to another level of PayPal account recently because they instituted a policy whereby if want to receive more than $100 worth of funds from a credit card to your free account you either need to refuse the payment or upgrade .
Upgrading was free but they then let you accept credit card payments above $100 but there is a 2.2% processing fee .

This doesn't really bother me because I can understand the costs involved shouldn't be swallowed by them I just think it was kind of cheesey the way they did it , ie . waiting until I had money pending and then springing this on me as opposed to just requesting that I upgrade .
Overall though PayPal is an excellent service and I would definitely recommend to anyone , in fact I do when someone involved in a auction doesn't use/accept it I will recommend they sign up .
First of all they'll give you both $5 for the sign up and it just makes the whole transaction process so much faster , and safer than just seding off a cashiers check .
My husband and I both have accounts with Paypal , and both are very unsatisfied .
Unfortunately if you are a seller on Ebay , it is almost a requirement , if you want to attract buyers .
My husbands problems strted when all of the sudden Paypal decided to limit his account access .
he went to their resolution center , and followed the simple instructions , to verify his phone # and email .

he did this , Paypal then sent a letter , saying that they needed more info , and for him to complete more steps before the account would fully accessible again , the only reason they gave for this was that his account was connected to another email address .
he informed that there was no other email , address , to please tell him which address they were referring to , and to give him the steps to resolve this .
All they told him , was that they could give the email address , and he needed to resolve the issue with this " other " email .
Well , he is kind of stuck , I mean what is he supposed to do , he cant send or receive payments and has no way to figure out to solve this .
My problem started when I ordered some items from a website accepting paypal .
I mistakenly spent more money that was in my account , well this automatically takes money from your bank or credit card .
Paypal charged my bank account , but I did not have enough funds .
So , without my ever knowing , Paypal paid for these items for me .
I had no idea that they did this , I hab=ve never read or heard anything about it .

Well , now I owe Paypal this money , AND my bank because Paypal attempts to charge my bank account at LEAST twice a day , so my bank is charging overdraft fees , and paypal is charging , and this is just snowballing .

I contacted Paypal , explained all of this to them , that I was never informed that they would pay for my order , and that as long as they were charging my bank , I couldn't pay them , because I could never get caught up , due to NSF fees , etc . .

Paypal basically said too bad , my bank can't put a stop on it , because it is not an acrual paper check , and they cannot access it , and since my bank account is now overdrawn , I cannot cancel this account .
I'm screwed as far as my bank and Ebay are concerned , and believe it or not , due to Paypal constantly tapping my account , I am now overdrawn in my account $1000 !
Paypal is a ripoff , they do not inform of littel fees and services they provide,are not willing to work with you on problems , and obviously do not care about their customers .
Of course since EBAY owns Paypal , why does any of this surprise me ?
## URL : http://www.epinions.com/webs-review-3105-C6A4A9E-3A3ADC87-prod1
## Topic : The Circle of Life
## Score : 4.0
## Recommended : Yes
He drew a circle that shut me out --
Heretic , rebel , a thing to flout .
But Love and I had the wit to win :
We drew a circle that took him in .
--Edwin Markham
Throughout history , people have grown more aware of the world around them .
When once people rarely traveled from the village where they were born , now we can travel around the world and beyond .
As our ability to travel has increased , so has our desire to have contact with people outside our immediate area .
Our ingenuity in using the latest technology to do so has lead to many amazing , and sometimes silly , solutions .
One solution in this digital age is online communities .
eCircles is one such community .
Offering a myriad of ways to keep in touch , such as message boards , web site lists , and photo albums , keeping in touch with family or making new friends is simple .
Do Circles Have Beginnings ?
The first thing to do , of course , is register .
It's blissfully short , one short page with few questions beyond name , email , and a few demographics .
After registering , a member can start participating immediately--there's no waiting for emails that might not ever arrive .
You can update your profile whenever you want , and there's a lot you can list if you choose .
You can also pick a " character " to represent you to other members .
They range from models to aliens , so there's something for everyone .
Members can start a group immediately .
Groups can be public or private , and can have as many or as few of the features available as you wish .
Most of the features are designed to help the groups stay organized and in touch .
The first feature seen when going to a group's page is the announcements .
These are short messages about a third of the way down the main page that can be used to alert all members of the group of something .
Anyone can add an announcement that's up to 500 words , and photos can be added .
Beneath the announcements are the other features .
First are photo albums , that anyone can start and add photos to .
Digital photos from an album can be used to order glossies , which is a nice touch .
The photos are a little expensive , and opening the order page requires closing the main browser window , which really bugs me .
Sitting In at the Round Table
Fortunately , most of the other features don't have such annoying habits .
Adding an event to the calendar is much like using an organizer .
Events can be one time or repeated , and you can ask people reply .
Notes about vacations or other long-term events can be added as well .
Setting up web links is also easy .
Links can be added to existing links , or a new list can be started .
For discussions that don't really fit into announcements , eCircles offers Discussions ( man , they're good ) .
Replying to or starting a new discussion is easy , as is reading a current discussion .
Several messages are shown on each page , cutting down on load time to go from one to the next .
There are also chats , both text and voice ; events planning ; a wish list ; file sharing ; and virtual gifts .
Could they even conceive anything more ?
Of course : group email .
Discussions can be mailed to members , rather like eGroups .
The email addresses are ( groupname)@ecircles.com .
You Spin Me Right 'Round , Baby . . .
Searching for groups to join is easy , although the search area is hard to find if you're signed in .
It's tucked away on the right side of the screen , and doesn't have a search box .
Once you get to the search area , however , the task is pretty simple and the results are rather relevant .
Joining is as easy as pressing a button , if it's open .
Some clubs require approval for new members , which is as easy as typing a note and sending it off .
Getting around clubs and all their features is easy .
Most features are listed on the main page .
Once you're logged in , links to all your clubs are offered ( with nifty icons to boot ) .
Your " inbox " offers recent discussions in your clubs .
The advertising is even unobtrusive .
Well , as unobtrusive as banners can be .
The color scheme is also lovely .
Back Around to the Beginning . . .
I highly recommend this site to anyone looking for a way to keep in touch with friends or family , or who is looking to join others with a common interest .
The first thing to do , of course , is register .
## URL : http://www.epinions.com/webs-review-4F08-4AE585A-3A271009-prod1
## Topic : eCircles - Great for all circles !
## Score : 5.0
## Recommended : Yes
The National Honor Society at my high school decided to join this eCircles.com community , and so far , I think it's the best way for communication within groups !
Consisting of over 140 members , eCircles.com allows our Honor Society to send out last minute announcements and all other events with more convenience .
Also , there are discussion boards , and many people within the circle can discuss topics relevant to our organization and just school in general by posting messages .
This communication allows us to get to know each other better outside of school .
Chat rooms and Photo albums allows more interaction within our group as well .
The site is also very easy to navigate , and you can join more than one circle !
There are many circles of interests and organizations too .
A list of members with their email and all other information provided is valuable in getting to know the other members .
If you cannot visit the site everyday , there are e-mail alerts that announce certain events posted or messages posted in the discussion board , which is very convenient .

However , sometimes the alert email about new messages or events are slow , for example , I got a message about a topic posted in the discussion board , and a couple days later , I got another email telling me that there are new messages have been posted .
This aspect of the community may become annoying with a heated discussion .
All in all , if you're a large group , organization , or family , eCircles.com is definitely a worthwhile site to keep in touch !
## URL : http://www.epinions.com/webs-review-4140-20C7E5F-39CC2615-prod1
## Topic : A Cute Community !
## Score : 4.0
## Recommended : Yes
This is a really fun place to build a community !
One of the best features about eCircles is the character icons members select to represent themselves .
When any member logs into eCircles , they get to see the " faces " of friends and family in their circle .
It makes a very nice introduction to web communities for somebody who hasn't got much web experience . eCircles have a very friendly , homey atmosphere that all my members like .

These communities offer all the things the more commercial services like eGroups do : there is chat , file sharing , community calendars , and the like . eCircles makes things a little simpler to understand , though .

For example , whereas an eGroups user has to know that photos , music and text or other files all go into the same files section , at eCircles , there are separate areas designated for each of these things .
There is also a really nice function , added just recently , which helps members to plan events and collect info from RSVP's .
A member planning a party can find out not only who will be attending , but how many guests , what food they plan to contribute , if they have any allergies , etc . , etc .
Questions are user defined , so they can be changed to suit the occasion .
There is also a wish list section where the guest of honour for a party can specify what they would like to receive .
It works just like a store gift registry , and in fact allows members to buy items online at specific stores .
Or they can simply tick off that they are buying the item , so it won't be duplicated .
The only thing lacking at eCircles until just recently was it didn't really work as a mailing list .
There was the option to send mail to individuals or the whole group , and if respondants hit the " Reply to All " button when they wrote back everybody could be included in the discussion .
Unfortunately that didn't leave the member with a choice to be included or not .
Now , the discussion forum has been upgraded to include the possibility of sending out posts as email messages .
Members can opt to receive these emails or not .
And the really great bonus is that the choice can be made globally , or based on the subject matter of a conversation thread .
If a particular thread isn't of interest to a member , he can simply opt out of that conversation !
My little group of students and extended family really enjoyed eCircles while we were small .
As we got bigger , most of us got involved in an overlapping group I was running at eGroups , so we have mostly stopped using the eCircles site .
I think if the upgrade to the discussion forum had come a little earlier , though , we would have opted for eCircles 100% rather than shifting over to eGroups .
The only complaint I've had at all was that the large amount of graphics made the pages slow to load , even at 56K .
Our Mac users actually had trouble getting pages to load at all sometimes , though they found things worked better if they were using Explorer as a browser .
The technical support staff were very helpful with that problem .
In fact , they were very attentive to our many suggestions and occasional problems over a period of several months .
( Sometimes we were in daily communication with them , just making suggestions and asking questions about how things worked ! )
They definitely rate an A+ for service !
This is a great service for smaller communities , and also for groups that are very active offline .
The circles can be organized along the lines of family , friends , school groups , community groups , special occasions like an upcoming wedding , etc .
Each category comes with a different little icon , and all a members' groups and their icons are displayed in a circle formation at login .
The concept is really cute !
Meggie's Mama

## URL : http://www.epinions.com/webs-review-5C85-3EAAF83-39D0EE4C-prod1
## Topic : I won my digital camera from them ! !
## Score : 5.0
## Recommended : Yes
I started with Ecircles when it was still in it's infancy .
I originally signed up for a chance to win a digital camera .
I went for it because it was not based on luck but on skill .
I actually won twice but did not claim the other camera to be fair to others who were trying for this camera .
I really think this was a great idea and one I wish I had thought of .
I put it right up there with the creation of Epinions.com .
*grin* The basics of it is that you can create groups based on your interests and invite friends to join .
You can also create groups for your family only .
I have done this so I can share with my family news of what is going on with my life and they can find out at their convenience .
There is much you can do when you have created or joined a group .
My favorites have to be the photo albums and the add links features .
Anyone in the group can create and upload photos and only those people that are in that group can view them .
A new feature has been added that also allows you to order prints from the photos uploaded .
At the time of this writing there is also a contest you can enter when you order prints to win yet another digital camera .
I am not going to go for it as mine that I won before still works great .
I mean no point in being greedy , right ?
The add links feature is a great way to share your favorite links or promote your own sites that you have created .
People you invite can invite other people so the possibilities for getting your site noticed are great if you have an active group .
Some other neat features worth mentioning are :
Add News : this feature allows you to add news of your choosing to your circle .
This way you can share news of what interests you or what may be related to the group you are in .
Add An Event : you can add an event , or post news of a meeting to your group members .
Add A Discussion : Start a discussion on your groups topic .
Be forewarned though it may turn into a debate .
Send Messages To Group : here you can email your entire group if you have something you think everyone should see or just want to say " Hi " .
Add an Announcement : got something to say to everyone ?
You can post it as an announcement .
Text and Voice Chat : hold a chat and invite all or some members from the group .
I have used both and they are really fun .
Add A File : got an MP3 you want to share , how about a neat piece of freeware you found or that cool .wav you came across the other day ?
You can add it here .
Create a List : Keep track of your favorite items and let your group know what you like from books , movies and music to many other things .
Calendar : each group also has a calendar and you can post important dates on it .
Birthdays , anniversaries , upcoming group meetings , special days , etc .
The possibilities are limitless .
I recently created an ecircle called Addicted to Epinions .
I created this as sort of a support group after reading some comments and reviews saying they needed a support group for their Epinions addiction .
Well one exists now .
*grin* If you want to join you can email me and I will send you an invitation .
I also have several other groups I have created and will be more than happy to send a list of current categories .
They really could use some more life .
LOL .
That is the one drawback I see really to Ecircles .
You have to email people to join your groups .
I do wish they would implement a sort of banner program for those that have websites to direct users to the groups they have created if they wished to .
I would not use it for my family groups but would be a great resource to promote my general interest groups .
You no longer have to email people to join in your Ecircles .
As of today --October , 7 , 2000-- there is now a directory of Ecircles and you can make your existing circles public if you wish .
There is still the option to keep them private if you like and I keep my family ones by invitation only .
The current directory breakdown is as follows :
Family and Genealogy
Sports and Recreation
Arts and Entertainment
Society and Culture
Health and Medicine
News and Media
Friends and Social Groups
Business and Investing
Computers and Internet
Home and Garden
The adult section has been removed according to an email I received from ecircles .
Apparently it was causing too many problems for them .
I have heard nothing since they informed me they were deleting that section .
IMO it would have been better to enforce some sort of password protection or age authentication but was probably too much of a hassle so they opted for the easy way out .
Ahh Ecircles was fun while it lasted .
Sadly Ecircles is no more .
*pout* *sniff* I had a great time there .
I had also created a private circle for just close friends and family so I could post pictures of my son and news of what he was doing .
Good news though , there is another place much better than Ecircles in some ways .
It is called CommunityZero .
You can join free and I have several groups already in place .
If you had an ecircle you can check it out at : http://www.communityzero.com/

## URL : http://www.epinions.com/cmd-review-232E-D218175-38EA3841-prod4

I was really glad to learn about this site .
A friend pointed me here to join one of her circles and I quickly began using it for my family and friends who are spread out across North America .
eCircles offers a variety of neat features that enhance your groups communication .
My family groups enjoy sharing photos together , using a calendar that everyone has access to , posting discussion topics and using a fun chat feature .
The photo album feature is an especially nice one .
They make it very easy to upload photos to your own personal album .
I always reduce the size of mine and keep them below 30KB , just to speed up the upload , but they can be as big as 125K .
It's a wonderful way to keep up with the grandparents , aunts , and uncles !
The calendar feature is good but not excellent .
I share things like birthdays , anniversaries , vacation times , and other dates that I think my family needs to know .
I said " not excellent " because I haven't yet found a way to make an " All Day Event " .
All events have to have a time assigned to them , so my birthday , for example , begins at 9am and is over by 10am .
Not a big deal at all , but not perfect either .
I also really like the discussion feature .
Our family has been planning Grandma's 80th birthday blowout on ecircles .
It's nice , because we span several time zones , so you can participate in the discussion but not have to schedule phone calls with 6-8 people .
The chat feature is just FUN .
Cousins chat on here a lot and it's a funny bunch of " quickies " that they offer you to use .
It's like some of the other messenger programs , where it allows you to use a " quickie " to simulate the emotion that you're having while chatting .
Very funny for the teen crowd ( or just the wacky post teen crowd like me ! ) .
eCircles also offers voice chat , file sharing , lists ( great for birthday wish lists ) , and other features that I haven't used as much .
It's a site with a lot to offer .
The graphics are stylish and fun . . . especially the characters that you get to use to represent yourself .
I've been keeping in closer contact with family and friends than ever before !
That's a real plus for me .
Then , when we get together in person , it doesn't feel as though it's been such a long time since we've spoken !
Yeah for bringing people closer !

## Topic : Mea culpa , mea culpa , mea culpa
## Score : 2.0
## Recommended : No
On an earlier review , I reviewed Schwab...I was ticked at the treatment I had just gotten from them so I decide to go to e-trade .
What a mistake !
Talking about incompetence , abrasiveness and pure worthless service .
E-trade has it all .
I guess the adage " you get for what you pay for " applies here unequivocally .
For one , let me tell you about their trading mechanism .
If you put in a trade that is even 1c over the margin , the order gets bounced and you don't know this until you go through several screens .
Now , note that the Security and Exchange Commission ( SEC ) allows you to bring in the money within three days of the trade , but not when you trade with e-trade .
All my trades were insured by using several option strategies but this is insufficient as far as their ridiculous calculator will allow .

So , the long and the short of it is , I had to pay them extra commissions to get less shares and I didn't even get some trades that would have allowed me to capitalize greatly in the great bear market of 2000 .
As for topic two , as an active trader , I should have gotten a refund for my trades above a certain number .

Until I sent them several e-mails and I spent a lot of time on the phone with some acrimonious chick ( I hung up on her ) and then with a pretty pleasant guy , I could not get them to refund me the money .
In one of my e-mails , I had to quote their own commission schedule/policy so that they would get it .
How many people have these guys ripped off who may not have been as alert as I was ?
And then came the coup de grace .
I owned RJ Reynolds stock on which I sold call options .
The exercise of the option was listed on my account on the same day as the x-dividend day .
They claimed that the dividend was " assigned " on the day previous .
A very convenient claim after the fact .

If you understand how this works , then you realize that the exerciser of the option is not entitled to the dividends since it was exercised on the x-dividend day but even if it was " assigned " the day previous , it takes a day for the option to come to market , and that would have been the x-day and thus no dividend .
No e-mail or phone discussion could make them understand this little subtlety .
But , oh , after all , what is the education of these " brokers " and how much are they getting paid ?
Let me tell you about how to beat their own phone game since they think they are so clever .
If you key in anything but the fact that you want to trade , you are doomed into oblivion for the next millenium ; but if you key in that you want to trade , then you are in within seconds .

And then make sure that they do not put you on hold because you will return to the land of Oz ( I don't know why I made this reference here...it just sounded good at the time ) , I guess the land of fantasy ! ?
If you want so called inexpensive trading at great displeasure go to e-trade but just consider this : if you trade with e-trade , you save 10 over Schwab but you are in for $12 more than ameritrade .
If you want cheap , go to the cheapest ( American Express allows FREE trades in some instances ) .
If you want brokers , you'll get someone who most likely has less savvy than your toddler .
And if you want execution , go see Marie-Antoinette .
What does e-trade offer ?
It is a mediocre company , that gives you mediocre service at mediocre prices .
If mediocrity is your game , have at it .
Oh Gods from Schwab , forgive me from my transgression , I am back .

I was a longtime E-trade customer with )$100K in various trading and bank accounts .
Despite my very strong preference for their online tools , their awful customer service has driven me to close my accounts and move to another brokerage .
Over the past few years , I have been increasingly horrified by E-trade's customer service .

I've had no problems with any of the online transactions , but whenever I have needed even the slightest bit of assistance from a live person , I have been shocked and appalled by the unresponsiveness and inability of E-trade to resolve very basic issues .
Some especially frustrating examples :

Example #1 : Transferring a Roth IRA from another brokerage is a very basic request , but it took ELEVEN MONTHS for E-trade to accomplish this task and correct the many errors that they made during the process .

E-trade lost the paperwork several times , deposited the funds in the wrong account ( which was a Traditional IRA thus creating another big mess ) , and it was extremely difficult to get them to take action to resolve the situation .
This transaction required no less than two letters , six emails , three phone calls , and two faxes from me to E-trade .
This absurd nightmare was undoubtedly the worst handling of a customer service issue that I have ever experienced .
Example #2 : Requesting a wire transfer from my E-trade Bank account .

E-trade was unable to process the request within the timeframe that was clearly communicated on the website , and I had to make several phone calls in order to get the transaction actually processed .
This caused a delay in the closing date of a real estate purchase and a significant amount of hassle and frustration for me .
Example #3 : Having to routinely wait 30 minutes or more on hold to reach E-trade via phone and wait a week or more for a response via email is completely unacceptable .

In the end , I am unwilling to keep assets at E-trade , where my access to customer service is marginal at best and where the organization has repeatedly demonstrated that it is not at all interested in nor adept at meeting my needs for basic support .
## URL : http://www.epinions.com/finc-review-4B9C-14099923-3A0C74E6-prod2
## Topic : E*TRADE's account maintenance fee changes my attitude
## Score : 1.0
## Recommended : No
The original review was written a while back and I wanted to add this update to express my disappointment with E*Trade .
I opened my account with E*Trade because there were no account maintenance fees .
After I had my account for about 1.5 to 2 years , I get a notice telling me that unless my account meets certain requirements , I would be charged $15 every quarter .
I was quite upset because I didn't meet that criteria but I let it go .
About 3 months ago ( I'm writing this in April 2002 ) , I get another notice saying that the $15 charge was going to be increased to $25 .
That's $100/year to have an account with E*Trade .
You think I'm going to put up with that ?
Heck no !
I called to find out what steps I would have to take to avoid the maintenance charge .
To close out my account , it would cost me more than I had in it ( thanks to the stock market the last two years ) .
The only other option was to rollover my 401k accounts into an IRA held at E*Trade .
The linked accounts of the IRA and the brokerage account must be $20k or greater to not be charged the account maintenance fee .
Well , I just so happen to have about that much so I am taking steps to do that because it costs too much to close the account and E*Trade is convenient for me .
I no longer recommend E*Trade .
It is nice but if you do not have the funds to avoid the maintenance fee , I highly recommend using a different brokerage .

E*Trade does not charge for the IRA accounts or the checking/savings accounts but the whole advantage to using E*Trade is to have all your money handled by one bank and E*Trade no longer makes those accommodations .
And who is to say they won't raise the fee AGAIN ?
If you keep reading , you can see that my attitude has changed .
Here is the original review :
Why I Selected E*TRADE
I created my E*TRADE account a couple of years ago for the sole purpose of trading stocks .
I knew absolutely NOTHING about stocks but figured I'd dip in .
The fact I was paid $75 for opening the account certainly helped my decision to use E*TRADE services .
The fact I could reasonably conduct online trading transactions was also a major attraction .
There were other services that offered a trade for less than E*TRADE's $19.95 charge but after weighing the convenience and the $75 , I chose E*TRADE .
After Opening My Account
I opened my account and put the minimum balance in it which was $1000 .
Sometimes , I think the minimum balance is as low as $500 .
It wasn't long at all before I bought my first stock , sold my first stock , and increased my portfolio to what it is today .
Unfortunately , the market has not been in my favor but E*TRADE doesn't have anything to do with that . . . sort of .
Sometime in March , I purchased E*TRADE stock because I was satisfied with their service and researched a little into the company .
The stock loss ground and is currently trading about half the price ( around $15 ) .
I sit here wondering with lots of analysts why this is happening to E*TRADE .
E*TRADE purchased a banking service ( TeleBank , as I remember it ) which is now known as E*TRADE Bank .
I'm currently using this service as a convenient means to transfer money to and from my brokerage account .
This , as you can guess , certainly made my E*TRADE experience much more pleasurable .
Problems With E*TRADE
Although I praise E*TRADE , my experience hasn't been flawless .
Earlier this year , I used to have some problems gaining access to my account through the web .
This was a mix of browser errors and errors on E*TRADE's behalf .
I could log in but not without a little aggravation .
I made a couple of calls to customer service and eventually , the problem was resolved .
My Experience With Customer Service
E*TRADE's customer service has been very responsive to every call and met my needs .
Time was reasonable without any long waits .
Additionally , I seemed to always get connected directly with the person who could solve my problem .
This is a huge plus for any customer support .
Would I Recommend This Service ?
Of course .
E*TRADE offers the online help that a new user might want to get a better grasp of his/her finances .
News is offered and a complete online help defines terms that a new trader will need to understand to be successful .
Overall , I think this is a wonderful service and more people will find out for themselves very soon .
## URL : http://www10.epinions.com/srvc-review-5CB4-47C66AE-385AC586-prod2
## Topic : Think Twice About E-Trade
## Score : 3.0
## Recommended : Yes

I've chosen to write about E-Trade , being that I've been a customer for over a year , and qualified for their highest level of service , the Power Trader , which is earned by placing LOTS of trades !
I chose E-Trade initially because they seemed to be one of the leaders in online trading , they seemed to have good research , and their prices weren't too bad either .
The Good
E-Trade has a pretty good interface , and lots of information to inform the average investor .
Their clean look and feel allows the investor , once logged in , to get to where he or she needs to go , without too much clutter .
The E-Trade Knowledge Center can make investing for the first time a whole lot less intimidating , and I'd rate the amount of research available to the user as above average .
As far as pricing , while you pay more than some Internet brokers ( Ameritrade , etc . ) , you still pay a relatively low commission .
The Bad
E-Trade , from time to time , will have major problems with their service ( translation - you can't execute a trade ! ) .
I cannot tell you how frustrating this is when trying to execute a trade .
This has happened to me well over 20 times .
Often times , the trade confirmation takes unusually long ( when this happens , DON'T hit sell/buy again or you'll end up buying or selling more than you wanted to ) .
To add insult to injury , when a problem does occur , the system asks you to call customer service to try to complete your trade with a live person .
Which leads to the UgLy !
The Ugly
I have , on several occasions , sat on hold for over an hour waiting for a customer support person .
On two occasions , while waiting over 45 minutes , their system HUNG UP on me !
I can imagine that many of the online brokers are going through some growing pains , but E-Trade's Customer Support is absolutely the WORST !
Mind you , once you get to speak to a live person , things aren't so bad , but good luck actually making that far .
I would recommend this service to the part time investor , who doesn't trade very often .
Their research and interface are quite good .
Otherwise , their lack of consistent service makes trading frequently too much of a headache ( and risk ! ) .
Check out other online brokers , like Schwab or Ameritrade .
## URL : http://www.epinions.com/content_18426596996
## Topic : When the novelty wears off . .
## Score : 3.0
## Recommended : No
During the wild and crazy days of the tech stocks , I spent most of my time watching and waiting for the whole thing to collapse .
Rather than invest in a single stock , I went with garden-variety mutual funds to reduce my risk .
Meanwhile , I watched my friends become rich ( on paper , at least ) .
In early 2000 , I decided to wade in -- intrigued by the promotions , I opened an account with E*TRADE .
Although there were numerous offers for gift certificates ( $100 at buy.com , several hundred at MicroCenter ) , I went with the $75 cash offer .
To E*TRADE's credit , my $75 bonus was credited promptly to my account .
Also , the few trades I made were executed without the delays that others have often complained about .
Of course , my trades were relatively simple .
Once tech stocks started to fall back to earth , I renewed my interest in mutual funds ( through another broker ) and spent far less time ( if any ) using E*TRADE for individual stocks .
I had decided to leave what I had in my account for the long term , and not worry much about it .
In February , I received a note with my monthly statement that mentioned a $15 quarterly fee for low-balance , low-activity accounts starting " this November . "
Because I received the note in February 2001 , and because the only date shown on the notice was " 2001 " on the back side , I assumed that " this November " meant November 2001 .
My account fell just shy of the minimum balance specified in the note .

I planned on waiting until the summer to decide whether I wanted to fund my account above the minimum balance , wait for the market to rebound which would've brought up my balance , or transfer the funds to another brokerage .
Much to my surprise , a $15 fee was subtracted from my account in March .
I called E*TRADE's customer service , and was told the policy was effective November 2000 , and that prior notice was given in past statements and on the web site .
I mentioned that the first notice I had seen was in February 2001 , and that the notice was extremely unclear that " this November " actually meant " last November . "
The rep insisted that the fee was non-negotiable , and that she was told that the notice clearly stated November 2000 .
When I insisted that the note lacked any mention of the year 2000 , she said I would need to fax the notice to them for inspection .
I asked to speak to a supervisor .
While waiting on hold , the rep talked to an account specialist who gave authorization to issue a " one-time courtesy " credit .
She gave me the option of waiting for the manager ( who was on another call ) or accepting the credit .
I decided on the latter .
I will now need to make a decision whether to keep my account or move it to another brokerage .
Low-balance traders who intend on making just one or two trades a year due should be aware that they may be charged a $15 fee every quarter .

I had my Etrade account since 1999 .
But just recently changed over to another brokerage .
In the early years , I was happy with them .
They were the web brokerage at the time and were decent .
I'm not an avid investor , more of a selective-passive opportunistic type .
I would sit on my account until something came along that I liked .
This was perfectly fine early on , but after the dot-com bust , things changed .
I could see Etrade's service deteriorate over time as they seemed to ignore small investors like me .
Customer service calls took longer and longer to connect to a representative .
Lots of hidden fees started cropping up .
When they implemented their " Account Maintenance Fee " , I thought I was okay at the time since the minimum amount required was $5000 and I had about $9000 in my account .
But later on they have been increasing this amount to the current $10,000 .
I finally got hit with this 'inactivity fee' ( I had ~$9940 in my account ) .
That pretty much was the last straw and I decided to leave them .
Unfortunately even that wasn't going to be easy , to my chagrin .
I decided to electronically transfer out my account ( Surprise !
Etrade charges $60 to do this ) .
But here's where things got bad .
I had $75 in cash at the time of which Etrade deducted $60 and sent me the remainder .
However , I learned from my new brokerage that Etrade had also charged them $60 fee for the transfer out .

I called Etrade and the customer service rep told me that they never sent a charge of $60 to my new brokerage firm and that it was deducted before the transfer ( pretty much implying that my new brokerage firm was lying about the charge ) .
After several back-and-forth calls between Etrade and my new brokerage firm , I got really frustrated .
Finally , upon calling Etrade a few days later , they admitted that they did send the charge and that they will resolve it in a few days .

To summarize : I think ETrade started on the right track with the goal of opening online trading to the masses , but along the way , they lost sight of the most important part of business : the customer .
Their fees are not on par with other online brokerages , and their service is well below acceptable in my opinion .

Fair warning : since this is basically a direct comparison between E*Trade and Datek Online , I posted it under Datek as well .

I've had a Datek account for a few years now -- was initially attracted to it by the fact that it had the lowest per-trade rates .
A while back , I got lured into switching to E*Trade ( it was those frequent-flyer miles , that's what did it ) -- within a month I was back at Datek .
Here's the thing -- after the clean , no-clutter Datek interface , E*Trade looked like a six-ring circus .
You want to make a trade at Datek , it's one click away .
You want to see how your portfolio is doing , it's one click away .
You want to look up what you did in April two years ago , well , maybe that's two clicks -- but you see what I'm getting at .
E*Trade , on the other hand , has a huge jumble of advice and opinions and trading tools and real portfolios and watch portfolios and there's just no easy way to do anything .
Yes , I'm sure if I'd given it a month longer I'd have gotten used to it and learned to tune out all the garbage .
But why bother ?
Here's the other thing .

I almost accidentally did a pretty fair test of how each company handled a somewhat complicated trade : at each brokerage I wanted to deposit some rule 144 securities in a paper certificate which needed to travel with a prospectus to be traded .
( If that's Greek to you -- it sure was to me the first time around -- suffice it to say that it was the sort of thing that needed a human being involved . )

Now , I won't go so far as to say that Datek handled it with aplomb -- it took a couple of phone calls to get it all straightened out -- but once I got past the first line of phone operators , they took care of the deal , kept me posted on progress , and generally acted like responsible businesspeople .
E*Trade , on the other hand , simply deposited the shares in my account as " nontradable " , with a dollar value of zero , and basically took the phone off the hook .

Every time I called I got a different person and a different story : " We aren't allowed to trade these , " " we have to charge a $75 fee to trade these , " " these aren't real shares , they're not worth anything"( ! )
, " you need to send us a copy of the prospectus " ( I had , twice , with cover letters explaining the whole routine ) , etcetera , etcetera , etcetera .
So that was the clue I needed to switch me back to Datek .
Who remembered who I was , and handled the Rule 144 shares with aplomb , the second time around .

## Topic : slow and very unreliable
## Score : 2.0
## Recommended : No
I saw tons of advertisements for ETRADE and at the time , ETRADE was offering $50 for opening an account .
I had thought therefore that ETRADE was the best on-line trading website on the web .
Well , after a year of trading I must say that I have been very disappointed with the service .
My first complaint is that when I opened the account , I did not notice that ETRADE had credited my account $50 , so I called their customer service .
They told me that it was all taken care of .
Well , so I waited a week and still my account hadn't been credited $50 , so I called again .
I must have called three times in all to get my credit .
ETRADE is so unreliable .
I work in the computer field , so I know that the transactions on the web are not too reliable , machines go down all the time .
However , this site is down so often .
I mean , how can this site be down so often .
What if my stock is plummeting and I want to make a trade , I guess you are allowed to call in and make a trade , but isn't the whole point of doing this on-line to avoid making calls ?
At time I can't even do a simple thing like checking stock quotes , I mean yahoo a free service with 10 times more users is more reliable than ETRADE .
There is something wrong here .
The execution is slow .
This is really frustrating if you are trading penny stocks .
I don't recommend trading pennies , but often times I will trade these .
The whole point of trading pennies is knowing when to get in when to get out .
Well there were times that I put in an order for let's say $1.00 .
The ask would be at like $0.95 and my order still wouldn't have executed .
This tells me that there is definitely wrong with the ETRADE system .
This is not that critical for most investors , but for those trading pennies with low volume and high volatility , speed of execution is key .
Lastly , I have an inside source who's been to ETRADE and has actually help them debug some bugs in their system .
ETRADE is supposed to be a hot new internet company with hot new technology right ?
Well wrong , ETRADE was an old trading company which just took their business to the web .
I mean they still use a VAX VMS system .
For those of you who are not too familiar with this , VAX was an old system which has been replaced by UNIX .
They do however use BEA Tuxedo which is pretty much the benchmark in transaction servers .
Bottom line is that I have been very disappointed with ETRADE .
I would move my account elsewhere , but it would just be too much hassle .
Besides , it's not like I have a million dollars in the account anyway .
Well happy trading .

## URL : http://www.epinions.com/finc-review-7136-6EDB7BF-38A300AB-prod6
## Topic : Review of Etrade
## Score : 5.0
## Recommended : Yes
I have been using Etrade since 1997 and I am very satisfied with their overall service .
Content :
You get to trade stocks , bonds , options and mutual funds .
There is a tremendous amount of information .
You also get Etrade specific index funds that come with no fee and no load .
The community and chat parts of this site are not that useful .
Not too many people use these features
Pricing :
Etrade is now one of the more expensive places to trade .
Commissions are 14.95-19.95 for regular accounts .
They do have an upgrde called Power etrade that gives level II quotes and trades as low as 4.95 if yo uahve more than 30 trades a quarter .
personally i trade a lot but haven't found it necessary to use this since I am not a daytrader .
I think for the amount of sevices that you get plus the reliability it is a good price .
navigation :
When I first joined ( even before this new site ) , I noticed that navigation was extremely easiy .
Finding different parts of the site was just as easy .
The new site is even better .
This site has a vast amount of information and services and they are very easily accessible .
Reliability and speed :
Execution times are among the best in the business .
However their reliability is average( border line below average ) .
Almost every day i get messages that I can not access vertain parts .
Charts are slow to load and until recently they had no TA charts .
Other features :
One thing that I like a lot is that Etrade doesn't get on my back regarding margin requirments .
Other sites might be a little quicker to ask you to liquidate or put mor money in but Etrade has been very good with that .
In fact that is one reason i won't switch to any other broker .
Plus , their execution is extremely fast and reliable .
I place a lot of limit orders and I have heard that other brokers are not as good with executing " close calls " .
After-hours trading is tricky .
since there is no market makers after the closing the volume shrinks up and the only way to make a trade is by matching the buyers and sellers electronically .
because of this they have made it a rule to not have any odd lots that means you can only trade 100 or 200 shares at a time .
Furthermore , just because small time investors are willing to pay a certain amount on a stock it does not meand teh market makers will agree with that price in the morning .
I have never placed an after hour order and I don't recommend it since there is not real stock quote and no liquidity .
Etrade has successfully integrated other companies products and services into their sites .
You can get discounts on a lot of things for becoming an Etrade customer including frequent flyer miles and PCs .
They have an amazing phone system too for when the site is down .
i like the cool voice recognition aspects that allows yyou to trade hands free .
i have used this feature when I was on the road and had no access to a PC .
They are also very good with helping you with taxes ( schedule D ) and cash transfers into the account .
Overall rating = A :
I recommend this site specially to beginners .
It is very secure , highly informative and easy to navigate .
I found that other sites are not as easy and beginners have had trouble getting around and placing trades .
Advanced traders might like the power Etrade features and portfolio management and option trading .
Personnaly , I do my technical analysis and chart viewing at other sites ( clearstation , askresearch ) .
On the bad side , Etrade does have technical problems often and it is slow to load .
In that case their phone ordering system is a good alternative .
Don't be fooled by other financial sites offering lower commissions .
You get what you pay for .
And of the love of god , do some research before buying a stock ! !

## URL : http://www.epinions.com/srvc-review-6A5D-16E602B9-38459FE4-prod1
## Topic : Overloaded with features , but a solid broker
## Score : 4.0
## Recommended : Yes
Those readers that have read my review of Datek know that Datek is my primary broker and why .
But I use E*Trade quite a bit as well , as Datek and E*Trade have very complementary feature sets .
Both are excellent choices for on-line brokers and aim at very different markets .
E*Trade is aiming to be the most feature-complete of the online brokers , offering a whole suite of bells and whistles that most other brokerages don't have .
In fact , they take a portal approach to online investing , encouraging its users to use their site as a consolidator for investment information on the web .
Their " Quotes and Research " page includes links to dozens of opinion columns .
They have a virtual avalanche of information available through their site .
But as I said in my Datek review , I don't consider this a big deal .
It's very easy to find high-quality free investment research on the web .
I don't really need my brokerage firm to provide it to me .
But E*Trade has lots of bells and whistles from a trader's point of view as well .

E*Trade has All or None functionality , some After Hours trading capabilities ( through Instinet ) , options trading ( both buying and selling , covered and uncovered ) , bond trading , and mutual fund trading .
They also have a system that allows E*Trade customers to participate in IPO's .
E*Trade also gives its users all kinds of value-added services such as the ability to create " pretend " portfolios , generate tax-related reports , and a fairly useful alert feature .
On the negative side , however , trades are a little more expensive than is typical on the web . $14.95 for NYSE market orders , $19.95 for NASDAQ market orders and all limit orders .
E*Trade also charges for some things ( such as real-time quotes ) that other brokers give away for free .
( E*Trade does have better pricing for frequent traders .
If you make more than thirty trades a quarter , you start receiving discounts . )
From a reliabality point of view , I think that E*Trade is probably the one of the most rock-solid brokers available .
They were one of the first online brokers and they learned how important reliability is in the early days .
Because of my job , I know a little bit about the behind the scenes architecture at E*Trade and the more I know about their systems the more impressed I am .
( I wish I could say the same about Datek . )
I've never experienced a time when E*Trade was perceptably slow ( let alone unavailable ) even during a busy market .
( Again , I wish I could say the same about Datek . )
As a final note , I have to mention how good the E*Trade customer service is .
I've never had to wait long on the phone and the support staff is very knowledgeable and helpful .
E*Trade has definately made it a corporate priority to keep their customers happy .
( A wise move considering the number of lower-cost alternatives . )
THE BOTTOM LINE :
E*Trade isn't the cheapest brokerage out there , but it has a very compelling feature set and its reliability record is hard to beat .
It's a good choice for beginners who want a single site for their research , and for advanced traders who want E*Trade's advanced features ( such as option trading and AON ) .

I was a huge fan of e-trade , mainly because I was able to keep my savings account somewhat liquid in a California Exempt tax money market .
This money market would earn twice the interest of a standard savings account , and the interest was not taxable .
What a great deal .
It was , until recently .
E-Trade just imposed a new fee for " non-active " traders .
This account management fee is a $15 every quarter ( 3 months ) starting in March .
To avoid this fee , you must complete two trades within six months .
Since two trades cost $40 , you are basically going to be charged either $30 or $40 every six months .
The other way to avoid this fee is have a total of at least $5,000 in liquid assets in your account .
I am not an active trader , nor am I well off enough to have that much in my savings account .
I have made only a a dozen or so trades in the three years I have had this account .

## URL : http://www.epinions.com/finc-review-DD-3763805-390DAC19-prod2
## Topic : E*Trade isn't perfect , but it's cheap
## Score : 3.0
## Recommended : No
I deal purely with corporate stock issues , and I have mixed emotions about dealing with E*Trade .
Their website contains a lot of information which can really help with deciding just when to pull the trigger on that big trade .
At the same time , when you actually DO pull the trigger , it sometimes takes the bullet a couple of minutes to leave the chamber , if you follow me .
Pros :
For basic trading , the website is set up so that it is very easy to navigate .
Most people will be able to figure out their way around the first time at the site , which can not be said for , I think , the majority of websites .
It's cheap .
At $14.95 for NYSE trades , and $19.95 for Nasdaq and limit trades , I believe Ameritrade and MyDiscountBroker.com are the only online brokers that are actually cheaper .
If you have accounts at E*Trade Bank , you can link your brokerage , checking , and savings accounts so that money can be transferred back and forth .
I love this feature because it eliminates having to wait 3-5 days for my checks to get clear across the country and into my accounts .
It also eliminates the wire transfer fees you would incur if you were in a bit more of a hurry .
There is a lot of helpful free information at your fingertips .
Some of it can be found for free at places like Yahoo !
Finance and CNBC's website , such as company profiles , financial information , news , and Zack's consensus reports .
The extra you get at E*Trade is Standard and Poor's stock reports , tracking of insider and institutional trading , and very useful technical analysis from clearstation.com .
Cons :
The site is either down , unuseably slow , or has a glitch on a far too frequent basis .
I can recall at least 5 days in the past year that I was so utterly unable to log in to my account that I simply gave up .
Thankfully none of those days coincided with important trades .
Because of site delays , trades you WANT to make can take up to 5 minutes to actually execute .
This is not to say that the trades arent executed promptly once the order is placed , but that it can take a while to navigate the site , and wait for the correct pages to load .
The free " real time quotes " can sometimes take as long as two minutes to come up on screen , and on occasion , although this is rare , have been as much as 5 minutes old .
Account information updating is often being delayed due to some site updating , or maintenance , or other website parlance of that sort .
Today , for instance , my Account Summary has not been updated for 4 days because of " maintenance " that occurred over the weekend .
Granted , my account balances can still be accessed , and the number represented is accurate .
It would be nice , however , if the information concerning my account were a little more consistent throughout the website .
Gripes :
When E*Trade introduced the account linking with E*Trade bank , a software glitch made it impossible to actually accomplish " linkage " the first 3 times I tried .
Someone else I know , who uses E*Trade , had a similar problem with linking their accounts .
It would be nice if streaming quotes were available to those who make less than 75 trades a year .
It gets a bit tiresome constantly requesting a single real-time quote over and over for 5-10 minutes when you're trying to get an exact idea of what a stock's momentum is at a given moment .
I work with computers , and I can understand occasional problems with websites , however , E*Trade really SHOULD be faster and more reliable .
Overall Impression :
It's a handy little site .
It has it's faults , but don't we all ?
It's cheap , it's easy to use .
If you don't make a lot of trades or deal in more complex securities , it's a good , simple brokerage .

I'll list a few of the worst examples :
The first incident with E*Trade customer service was that I needed to wire money out of E*Trade to an underwriter ( I was offered some shares of an IPO through a " friends and family " offer .

One day before the due date , I checked my E*Trade account balance to verify that the wire transfer actually occured .
It had not .
Immediately , I called up E*Trade and asked them what had happened .

The second incident with E*Trade was when one of my relatives closed her account .

So another three weeks pass and no check has arrived .
The account balance is back again minus $25 for a cancelled check fee .

A week later she gets the check minus $25 .
Web site :
I haven't traded much in the past 6 months or so , so perhaps E*Trade has improved their web site .
But ever since I've opened my account ~Jan '99 , their web site often states that there are problems with the server at that time .
Its often frustrating when trying to place an order and a " service unavailable " error displays .
I end up calling their trading desk to place an order , but this defeats the purpose of being able to trade online .
Once when the web site was slow , I ended up pressing " place order " button twice ; guess what , I purchased 200 shares instead of 100 .
After a couple of calls the order was reversed .
Ok , now the good things about the web site .
They now have graphs that displays your portfolio value over time .
A nice touch , but then again I have Quicken 2000 which can do more than that .
If you're an active trader ( Power E*Trade ) you have access to real-time streaming quotes and Level II quotes .
This was great back in the day when anything.com went IPO and was a big hit .
Recommendation :
I would tell anyone that wishes to open an online brokerage account to seriously think of using someone else besides E*Trade .
I've had nothing but good experiences with Schwab.com and MSDW.com .
If you just need a place to occasionally place a trade , I suppose E*Trade will suffice .
But just don't rely on them to do anything in a timely manner .

## Topic : A NIGHTMMARE ON E*TRADE STREET
## Score : 1.0
## Recommended : No
Here are my TOP 5 reasons against using E*trade .
Customer Service Reps are not helpful .
E*trade allowed $5894.95 to " Slip through the cracks . "
( That was the explanation given to me when I asked an E*trade rep . how my $1000 CASH account was allowed to be overdrawn .
E*trade's collection department treats customers with disrespect .
E*trade's " so called " trained specialists give customers wrong information and then say , " Oh well ! "
They receive checks that are sent as payment and don't process them in a timely manner and then sell the customer's stocks for not meeting Their Deadline ! ! !
I apologize for the length of this epinion but there was no way to shorten it and have it make sense .
Three weeks ago , as a gift , a friend decided to set me up with a $1000 cash account at E*trade .
We selected E*trade because their advertising seems targeted at both the beginner and experienced investor .
They make it sound so easy and promote how helpful they are .
So , I was excited as I had never had an opportunity to play the market before .
For the first week , I did not touch the money as I tried to learn about trading .
Finally my friend , who also is also a novice , suggested I buy 10,000 shares of penny stock at what we thought was .03 a share .
I put the trade through on Martin Luther King Day .
( The market was closed due to the holiday ) .

I noticed that the trade cost about $30 more than I anticipated so I called E*trade and told the rep I was a brand new trader and he explained that the market fluctuates and that I really had little to worry about .
( He never once explained the open market to me , so I thought my trade was being processed for about .034 per share . )
I told him I could live with the $30 difference and went to bed .
When I woke on Tuesday I rushed to the computer , logged onto E*trade and nearly passed out .
I sat staring at the screen because it said I owed $5894.95 as the stocks opened at almost .69 cents a share .
After getting a hold of my friend , he said there was some mistake as the account was a cash account and that the trade should not have gone through .
We both thought the most we could lose was $1,000 .
WRONG !

I called E*trade and was told I did indeed owe the money and when I asked the gentleman why the trade went through in the first place he said , " It slipped through the cracks , " and agreed that it should not have been processed .
Wonderful !
But that didn't matter as E*trade is not responsible for their mistakes .
I called my friend and he in turn called E*trade .
His experience went as follows .
Though he is not listed on the E*trade account in ANY WAY , the man he spoke with revealed personal information about me and the account to my friend .
He also explained that we had day plus three to get a check for $5894.95 to E*trade .
He mentioned to my friend that he could Fed-X the check but if the check was in the mail that morning , regular snail mail would be fine .
My friend wrote a check as he was speaking to the E*trade customer service man and mailed it two hours later , as instructed .
The next day , I get a call from a very rude man from E*trade .
I tried to explain to him what had happened and he kept cutting me off .
I tried to tell him I was new and didn't fully understand the procedures yet he went on to threaten me with being placed in collections even though I explained that the check was indeed in the mail .
Then he took it a step further and started humiliating me by saying .
" Okay , I want you to explain to me what an open market is ? "
I had just finished telling him I understood my mistake but he must have gotten some charge out of taunting me .
He had me so upset that in tears , I was forced to call my friend on my other phone line ( while the E*trade representative was on my main line ) to once again verify that the check was sent .
My friend explained once again the check was in the mail .
( The E*trade guy was able to hear . )
After hanging up with my friend , I was once again told I would be in collections and my account liquidated .
The same day ( Wed . morning ) my friend sent E*trade the check to Boston MA , he mailed me a letter to Salem , MA .
I had his letter by Saturday .
As of Tuesday , the followong week , E*trade still had not posted payment and as a result , they sold my stocks at a HUGE loss .
( about .14 cents a share )
I was furious but I calmly called E*trade and explained again what was going on .
They said they have a right to liquidate and that we should have wired the money .
GREAT !
That is NOT what my friend was told when he called .
My friend followed the recommended steps that the E*trade rep advised him to do and mailed it snail mail .
Now I am being told that is wrong .
I once again explained to the woman that we did exactly as instructed and that the person understood we were new to E*trade .
Sure , it is probably in writing somewhere but I would think that a trained representative of E*trade would know enough to give us the RIGHT payment information .
The woman said she would look into the matter and call me back within two hours .
After four hours I had not heard anything so I called back to speak with a supervisor .
Currently , he is looking into the matter and is tracking down the tapes of all conversations .
Yes , this was a $ $5894.95 lesson to learn and it has caused great anguish and frustration , especially in my contacts with E*trade .
I hope another new investor like myself will think twice about dealing with E*trade as they seem to have policies that release them from liabilities even when they make errors .
I know the stock market is risky , but I thought all I could lose was my initial $1000 since it was a cash account .
Live and learn .
I would not even recommend E*trade to my enemies .

## Topic : Not necessarily *the* best , but much better than most all else .
## Score : 4.0
## Recommended : Yes
I should start out by stating that I have only used their investing side of things , and within that , only US equity markets ( stock markets ) .

ETrade offers more than just that , they have banking ( which a friend has told me is quite good ) , and they have a lending section as well ( which I have not ever even glanced at , so I have no clue there ) .
I should also note that the account that I use isn't mine .
That probably sounds weird , but as a favor for a good friend , I trade his money and make him money .

I like doing it , and he likes making money , so it all works out ( my expertise is in programming , and I happen to be pretty good at programming code that does financial analysis on equity markets ) .
When I eventually setup my own account , I would consider ETrade , but I am much more likely to use Interactive Brokers - they are much more suited to a daytrader or swing trader like myself .
All of that said , I will review what I like about the ETrade that I know and use .
I use " Power ETrade " .

The account was already setup for that when I started it , so I don't know exactly what that entails , but as I understand it once you make over a certain number of trades a month at their regular trading fee ( which is $15 I think , or something around there ) , then you get bumped to " Power ETrade " and there are new options available to you .
I don't use any of those options that I know of , but I do get a $9.99 trading fee instead .
Lower trading fees are always good .
I believe most of the other options are real time data streaming and programs that you can install on your system for day trading type things .

The account I use isn't a margin account , so I can't really day trade on it , so I don't bother with anything more than the normal trading interface and the " unrealized gains " view of the portfolio .
ETrade is laid out in a way that is easy to use and figure out .
You can get to any section relatively quickly .

There are slight quirks in the interface - such as when you are in the portfolio section , the only way to get to the trading screen is to select to buy/sell one of your holdings - or you have to go to the investing root node - you can't get right to a trading screen or the open orders screen .
If you are on a fast connection , this really doesn't matter at all since ETrade has fast loading pages .
But on a slower connection this can be really aggravating if you are trying to get something done quickly .
I don't use the site for research , for real time quotes , or anything other than putting the trades through .
As a result , there is a lot of extra stuff there that isn't needed .
What is needed are low trading fees and fast execution times .
The execution times are good .
The trading interface is good and easy to understand .
The pages load very quickly and are visually good enough .
One of the best features is that when doing TurboTax online , ETrade is one of the brokers that can automatically integrate to get the tax information .
ETrade is not the best for someone that just wants a good , fast , and cheap trading system .
But that isn't what they are claiming to be good at - they are a full service system that is supposed to be helpful to the uneducated investor as well .
As a result , I would say that it is better than average for trading , but really more suited to investing .
You can get into mutual funds , bonds , options , stocks , and setup IRAs .
It has full featured trading available , but a lot of it is add ons that you either pay to upgrade to , or you need to trade a lot to be offered .
My overall rating is that it is great for someone that likes to occasionally buy and sell some stocks ( occasionally meaning maybe even as often as 3 times a month ) .
But I still don't think it would be appropriate for a day trader - it would work , but you would be paying to much for all of the extra features that you don't need .

## URL : http://www10.epinions.com/srvc-review-2E8E-4EF14BC-385BEB18-prod2
## Topic : Online Broker , Incentives
## Score : 4.0
## Recommended : Yes
I originally opened an E*Trade Account to take advantage of the $75 incentive plan .
Briefly , under the terms of the offer , for an initial $1,000 investment , E*Trade would credit your account $75 .
The offer stated that you would need to keep your account open for a minimum of six months .
This was in July .
In addition , E*Trade has strategic marketing agreements with First USA credit card and United Airlines .
You can earn miles for having your friends sign up for an account , and apply for a low APR credit card .
Further , they are offering a deal for free AOL for a period of time .
Now , and apparently for a limited time , they are offering $100 to open an account .
The purpose is three-fold , at least .
See below for rationale as to why they are doing these incentives .
THE NUTS AND BOLTS
As a preliminary matter , E*Trade is not for unsophisticated investors who are looking for investment advice ( in my opinion ) .
Otherwise , E*Trade has good fundamentals at its site .
Good research options , expanded quotes for stocks and option trades and , on average , $14.95 stock trades .
This is at or about the industry average .
The drawbacks for E*Trade is that you must be willing to deal with them almost exclusively over the Net .
No branches to my knowledge .
However , they do have telephone support at 1-800-STOCKS .
This means that any deposits or transfers of securities to your account must be done electronically and via mail ( mailing documents with your signatures required in many instances ) .
Further , you will have difficulty sometimes getting someone on the phone if you have questions about a trade or your account .
E*Trade offers real-time quotes , naturally , and for more active traders , they offer $4.95 stock trades , Power E*Trade .
The biggest negatives about E*Trade , I also have Scwhab and traditional brokerage accounts , is that the transfer of securities to your acccount , in my view , takes longer than necessary .
In addition , it took longer than I would have liked to open the account .
Accordingly , don't expect to open your account today , and begin trading tomorrow .
Further , I have found it difficult to get representatives on the phone .
E*Trade represents that they will accept conditional offers for IPOs .
Whether you , as an account holder will be accepted is another matter .
I personally have never tried to participate .
After Hours
E*Trade offers after hours trading .
I have never done .
I personally have issues with respect to whether that market is liquid enough at this juncture .
WHY THE AGGRESSIVE PUSH FOR CUSTOMERS ?
One , they are signing up customers to increase their asset base .
More assets , they hope , means more trading , more velocity to the accounts ( as the term is used in the industry .
More velocity means more commissions .
Two , more customers means more eyeballs .
More eyeballs means more ad revenues .
Third , more assets and eyeballs , means under the new paradigm , that the company should be afforded a greater market value for its stock price .
NOTE : DLJ DIRECT IS OFFERING A SIMILAR $100 BONUS FOR A LIMITED TIME .
Ultimately , many see E*Trade as a takeover candidate from a larger financial services company because of its customer base .
In fact , the CEO and founder is to be given a special compensation arrangement in the event the company is acquired .
Look for a great deal of consolidation in the industry .

I tried to register on eTrade .
It took forever .
When I finally got to the final page , it said " Hit enter just once or else you may get multiple accounts " .
Well , I hit it just once and it wasn't enough .
After all the data inputting , no account was created .
I tried calling the " help " desk , but no help .
So I tried again online .
Again , it took forever .
Finally , on the third attempt I got an account .
I wish I hadn't .

To get an account you need to put in every little bit of info ( your grandmother's first boyfriend's sister-in-law's maiden name type stuff ) I can understand this due to fed regs , but it is quite an ordeal .
As such , you would think eTrade would want to help .
They need both your bank account number and your bank tracking number .
Not having worked in banking , I was unsure of what this info would be .

So , as a " helpful " hint , when it comes time to supply your bank account info so they can take your money , eTrade has a photo of a check on their website which identifies the first segment of numbers as the tracking numbers , the second series as account numbers and the third as checking numbers .
So , following their own instructions , I entered the first series off of my check for the tracking number and the second series as my account number .
eTrade confirms that everything is fine and I purchase some securities .
A lot of trouble , but now I'm on my way...or am I ?

A few days later , I receive a letter in the mail saying that my bank refused the money transfer and unless I wired eTrade the money or messengered them a cashiers' check immediately , not only would they liquidate my account , they may even liquidate my account before then just for the heck of it ( i.e . even if I get them the $$ my securities would be sold ! )
Why eTrade would tell me my account was set up to begin with and let me purchase securities without having money in my eTrade account sounds like a stupid way to run a business .

Which brings up another big question- why would eTrade send a letter to me which arrived Saturday afternoon right after the banks closed for the rest of the weekend when not only does eTrade know my e-mail address it even asks if it should send notices to my e-mail address ( I checked yes , but hey why should I assume that means anything )
I called my bank to see what the problem was .
It turns out that my bank ( Bank of America ) puts the check number as the second series , not the third as represented by eTrade .
As such , eTrade didn't get the correct info .
No problem I thought .
eTrade would simply re-process the order against my correct account number .
WRONG !
I was told that I still needed to wire them the money ( a $30 fee ) , messenger them the money ( a $25 fee ) or have them liquidate my account ( tax hit ) .
I explained that this whole problem came about because I followed the instructions on their website .
I was told , almost verbatim , yes you followed our directions , but we consider this to be your mistake .

( I will note that the telephon operator at eTrade was friendly and recognized that it was eTrade's fault , but when she went to her supervisor to see what could be done , the " its your fault you listened to us " response was what she came back with ) .
I will never use eTrade again .
I 100% recommend that all readers use DayTek , or Charles Schwabb or Fidelity .
Even if it costs a little more ( which I don't believe it does ) what's a few cents when it means that you get true service !
